title.narrative: Appropriate policies, programmes and practices that promote and ensure women's economic empowerment at both national and local levels are adopted and implemented

description.narrative: This outcome will focus on strengthening capacity of key institutions (MoEWOE, MoL, GED, MoWCA, local authorities and private sector) and networks of gender equality advocates to have in place evidence-based policy revisions and formulations. It will also focus on capacitating the monitoring of policy implementation and strengthening women's voices from the marginalized groups (women migrant workers and women in specific economic sectors such as RMG) to influence policies and hold GoB and other development actors accountable for fulfilling their commitments and upholding women’s rights.
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Tea garden workers, notably women workers, have increased capacity to negotiate and exercise collective voice to influence policies and hold the Government of Bangladesh and the Bangladesh Tea Association accountable for integration of tea garden workers

description.narrative: This output is added under SDGs fund join programme

title.narrative: Number of sessions on gender equality issues are organized that created space for women workers to learn together and raise collective voice for their rights.
Indicator 2.1.2.A: Number of Tea garden women workers have enhanced life skills to increased leadership capacity and able to apply at all levels.
Indicator 2.1.2 D: Number of reports/ op-ed/articles published in the media (social media, print media) that highlights Tea garden women workers rights issue.
